title: Spring forces - spring between accelerating cars

content.question: Two carts are attached by a spring with spring constant <math alttext="1000 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>. The cart on the right has a mass of <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kg</mi></math>, and the cart on the left has mass <math alttext="uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math>. A rope attached to the cart on the right exerts a force of <math alttext="100 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> on the cart. Both carts have the same constant acceleration and the spring is <math alttext="0.06 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.06</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> longer than its relaxed length. Assuming the mass and internal friction of the wheels are negligible, what is the value of <math alttext="uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> ?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
